title: 113_hr3663
content: The Act titled "Reducing Federal Mandates on School Lunch Act" prohibits regulations that establish certain limits for the school lunch program. The Act prohibits the implementation of certain regulations related to calorie and quantity limits for the school lunch program until a law extends program authorizations. The Act establishes maximum limits on calories and quantities of grains, meat, or meat alternatives for the school lunch program under the Richard B. Russell School Lunch Act. SEC. 3. PROHIBITION OF OTHER NUTRITION REGULATIONS FOR CERTAIN SCHOOL FOOD AUTHORITIES. Prohibition on implementing nutrition regulations for school food authorities until certain conditions are met. The school food authority may face increased costs due to compliance with operational procedures. The Secretary of Agriculture is prohibited from defining or suggesting how costs should be calculated. The regulations include nutrition standards for the National School Lunch Program and School Breakfast Program. The Department of Agriculture published nutrition standards for all foods sold in schools under the Healthy, Hunger-Free Kids Act of 2010. This includes regulations related to school lunch price increases. The Department of Agriculture published regulations under the Healthy, Hunger-Free Kids Act of 2010, including increasing school lunch prices. Part 220 of title 7, Code of Federal Regulations, establishes new meal patterns and nutrition standards for the school breakfast program. SEC. 4. RULES OF CONSTRUCTION. The Secretary of Agriculture is not prohibited from implementing, administering, or enforcing rules or regulations not described in this Act, or parts 210 and 220 of title 7, Code of Federal Regulations.
